title: tiktok star two women accused
story: TikTok star and two other women accused of A double murder in courtTikTok star Mahek Bukhari, , her mother, Ansreen Bukhari, , and Natasha Akhtar, , are charged in relation to the deaths of Saqib Hussain and Mohammed Hashim Ijazuddin, both TikTok star Mahek Bukhari is charged in relation to the deaths Image: InstagramBySuzy Gibson:,  Feb Three women accused of murdering two young men who died in a crash on the A in Leicestershire have appeared in court. TikTok star Mahek Bukhari, , her mum, Ansreen Bukhari, , and Natasha Akhtar, , are charged in relation to the deaths of Saqib Hussain and Mohammed Hashim Ijazuddin, both , whose silver Skoda Fabia crashed through the central reservation on the A carriageway, near the junction of Six Hills, at .am on Friday February .The two men, from Oxfordshire, were pronounced dead at the scene, Leicestershire Live reports. Leicestershire Police confirmed that two other cars, a grey Audi TT and a blue Seat Leon, were also travelling in the area at the same time.  Mahek Bukhari and Ansreen Bukhari, both of Stoke-on-Trent, and Akhtar, of Birmingham, appeared at Leicester Crown Court this morning via a live video link from HMP Peterborough. All three were wearing protective face masks while sitting next to each other, with Mahek Bukhari in the middle. Each acknowledged their names when addressed by the court clerk. There were no applications for bail during the  minute preliminary hearing.The prosecutor, James House QC, told Judge Timothy Spencer QC that two men had also been charged in connection with both alleged murders and were due to appear in the cityaposs magistrates court today. They are -year-old Raees Jamal, of Loughborough, and -year-old Rekan Karwan, of Northfields, Leicester, both also charged with murder. Mr House said they would also be brought to the crown court for a preliminary hearing in the next day or so. All five defendants are expected to attend a crown court plea and case management hearing on Friday, March . A provisional six week trial date was earmarked for Monday, September .  Judge Spencer remanded the three women back into custody. He told them: You face the most serious charge known to criminal law, do you know that  They replied: Yes. He told them they would be brought to court for the next hearing in March and askedthey understood, to which they also replied, Yes.Follow MirrorFacebookTwitterMORE ON Leicestershire PoliceMurderCourt caseMurder trial" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: valentines day couple gorge lobster
story: Valentines Day couple gorge on lobster before leaving without paying £ billThe couples receipt from the Mill in Stokesley, North Yorkshire, shows they ate mussels to start, Thai red chicken curry, half a lobster, a fillet steak with a peppercorn sauce and a side of halloumi friesPub owner Alex Cook asked the couple to pay up Image: Evening GazetteByKelly-Ann MillsNews ReporterKelley Price:,  Feb Updated:,  Feb |comments A Valentineaposs Day couple who gorged on steak, lobster and numerous bottles of wine at a pub walked off without paying, leaving the owners shocked.The pair racked up a hefty £. bill at The Mill in Stokesley, North Yorkshire, on Monday night.One of the pubaposs owners Alex Cook warned the couple they had been caught on camera and gave them a deadline to cough up the cash before going to the police, Teesside Live reports.The award-winning pub posted on Tuesday: To the lovely couple that racked up a hefty bill consisting of fillet steak and lobster, numerous bottles of wine. While we’re sure it was an honest mistake on your part that you left without paying, please pay your bill by  oaposclock today.You were sat opposite a camera and the CCTV couldn’t be clearer. Happy Valentineaposs, eh. Speaking to the Mirror Alex confirmed he tracked down the couple and asked them to pay. Eventually the woman called back and settled the bill, paying by card without leaving a tip. The coupleaposs receipt shows they ate mussels to start, Thai red chicken curry, half a lobster, a fillet steak with a peppercorn sauce and a side of halloumi fries. Their food was washed down with a large Coke and four bottles of Zinfandel wine.  Some followers were keen for the pub to name and shame the couple for their antics and many more were keen to seethey had eventually paid up. One follower Tricia Davis said: There is no need for it, businesses are struggling enough,you canapost afford to go out until you get paid, donapost go out, its so wrong, I feel sorry for the staff, puts so much pressure on them, its down right cheeky. They should have gone to Tesco got a meal for £. Katie Platt added: Blimey ! That’s a lot of wine on a school night. No wonder they aposforgotapos to pay.  Alex confirmed the bill was settled but added that the pair was also barred from the establishment for good. Many people were impressed with the pubaposs handling of the situation. Emma Gaulter said: They want to be thankful that you have been so understanding. Most businesses would have sent the CCTV to the police or at least put it on social media. Glad you got your money. John Phillips added: You’ve been calm and restrained and really clever about the whole nasty situation. Well done. news uk-news virginia-giuffre-may-speak-out-"Prince Andrew: What’s next for Duke after Giuffre settlement ByAlahna KindredNews Reporter:,  Feb Updated:,  Feb Virginia Giuffre may speak out about the Prince Andrew case after the Queenaposs Jubilee, it has been claimed. Yesterday, the Duke of York was spared a courtroom showdown after reaching a settlement in principle in the civil sex claim filed in the US with accuser Ms Giuffre.Ms Giuffre alleges she was forced by Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell to have sex with the Duke on three occasions after being trafficked by the pair. Andrew has always strongly denied Ms Giuffre’s claims.The sum of the settlement will not be disclosed, but it is estimated that the Duke has agreed to pay £million - including two million that is expected to go to Ms Giuffreaposs charity. A carefully worded statement published yesterday indicated that Ms Giuffre will continue to share her story and that the Duke will support the fight against the evils of sex trafficking”.  Furthermore, it has been revealed the -year-old disgraced royal plans on making a substantial donation to Ms Giuffreaposs charity in support of victimsapos rights. However, Ms Giuffre will be expected to wait before speaking in an apparent attempt to limit damage to the Royal Family during the Queenaposs Platinum Jubilee celebrations, The Times reports.  One lawyer not involved in the case suspects the settlement would allow Ms Giuffre to write a book about her side of the story. Mitchell Epner, a former federal prosecutor who is an attorney with the New York firm Rottenberg Lipman Rich, told The Times: Ordinarily, you would have a complete non-disclosure [agreement] on both sides.  He also said that in this case, “since it’s a settlement in the context of, on its face, an apology from Prince Andrew, he suspects Ms Giuffre “has agreed not to say anything [but] she will be in a position to write a book, probably for this Christmas season”. He added: “She will be free to say whatever she believes the truth is about Prince Andrew.”  Andrew has always denied Ms Giuffre’s claims and although a settlement has been reached he has not admitted any wrongdoing. Mr Epner estimates Prince Andrew has agreed to pay at least £.million to Ms Giuffre personally as part of the settlement.The legal deal will also include a donation to charity and legal fees. I have a reasonable estimate that his legal fees to carry the case through from where it is now to the end of a trial would have been million to million, he said. Yesterday, court documents published revealed that Prince Andrew regrets his association with paedophile Epstein and to show his remorse he plans on supporting the fight against the evils of sex trafficking, and by supporting its victims. A document submitted to a US court today said: Virginia Giuffre and Prince Andrew have reached an out of court settlement. The parties will file a stipulated dismissal upon Ms Giuffreaposs receipt of the settlement . Prince Andrew intends to make a substantial donation to Ms Giuffreaposs charity in support of victimsapos rights.  Prince Andrew has never intended to malign Ms Giuffreaposs character, and he accepts that she has suffered both as an established victim of abuse and as a result of unfair public attacks. It is known that Jeffrey Epstein trafficked countless young girls over many years. Prince Andrew regrets his association with Epstein and commends the bravery of Ms Giuffre and other survivors in standing up for themselves and others. He pledges to demonstrate his regret for his association with Epstein by supporting the fight against the evils of sex trafficking, and by supporting its victims. title: what deltacron hybrid omicron delta
story: What is Deltacron  Hybrid Omicron and Delta Covid iant found in UK being monitoredA new iant of Covid- dubbed Deltacron has been detected by a UK health agency that is said to exhibit characteristics of previous forms of the virus - heres what we know so farA new Covid iant that is a hybrid of the Omicron and Delta has been identied in the UK, but numbers are currently low Image: PAByHarry ThompsonTrends WriterNeil Shaw:,  Feb |comments A new iant of coronavirus has been found in the UK, with the country’s Health Security Agency now monitoring how it develops. The news comes after the UK has had to tolerate two years of Covid , with multiple iants like Omicron, Delta and Alpha taking it in turns to cause havoc, lock down the country and claim the lives of thousands of people. With signs emerging that Omicron is beginning to recede, the government has begun to dramatically scale back restrictions over the UK.In the biggest change yet, mandatory isolation for people who test positive for the virus is due to be lted on February . What is the new Covid iant   It has been labelled ‘Deltacron’ after seemingly exhibiting aspects of the Omicron and Delta iants that have, at dfering points, ripped through the UK. Its scientic name is BA. + B....Experts have reported it has developed in patients who caught both Omicron and Delta at the same time,WalesOnlinereports.The UK Health Security Agency, or UKHSA, is yet to deliver a verdict on how contagious this form of the virus is, or how dangerous it could be for people who catch it.According to theMail , the UKHSA is yet to announce how many cases of the hybrid have been found in the country.Professor Paul Hunter, an infectious diseases expert at the University of East Anglia, told MailOnline: If both Delta and Omicron are falling then, in theory, this [iant] should struggle to take off. Covid iants that are products of recombination are rare but have been known to form at points throughout the pandemic - three cases have arisen in the past with hundreds having been infected. Speaking to the MailOnline, a UKHSA source said: We monitor everything as a matter of course, but we are not particularly anxious about this iant. The developments have led to Deltacron being included in the UKHSA’s iant surveillance report.Indiareports that the iant was initially believed to be a laboratory error, however, its inclusion in the report has signalled that the iant is real.The same publication reports that the UKHSA is yet to report whether the iant was imported to the UK or whether it is native. The Mail report that sources at the UKHSA is “not concerned” by the iant with case numbers remaining low. The findings are contextualised by generally positive news about Covid, with the number of people who have tested positive up to February  having fallen by ,, or .%, in the last seven days. news uk-news whats-next-prince-andrew-calls-"Prince Andrew: What’s next for Duke after Giuffre settlement ByJenner NewtonRoyal Features Writer:,  Feb Prince Andrew has now reached an out of court settlement with his accuser Virginia Giuffre in a civil sex claim filed in the US. It means that he has now avoided a potentially explosive trial with the settlement said to be £million.In the past two years since giving a car crash interview on BBC Newsnight about his association with the convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein, Andrewaposs le has changed dramatically. Shortly after the sit-down interview, he sensationally quit public le - announcing it in a statement that was approved by the Queen.Meanwhile, just last month, the Duke of York was stripped of all his military affiliations and royal patronages by his mother the monarch. The statement from Buckingham Palace also said he would continue not to undertake any public duties. Now the civil claim against him has been settled, what could be next for Andrew  We take a look... Public roleThis year, Andrewaposs mother the Queen is celebrating her Platinum Jubilee after marking  years on the throne.In June, there will be a host of celebrations on a bumper four-day long bank holiday weekend. So will we see Andrew at these events or indeed carry out public duties in the future now a settlement has been agreed According to former BBC royal correspondent Jennie Bond, absolutely not. Love the royals for the Mirroraposs daily newsletter to get all the latest news on the Queen, Charles, Kate, Wills, Meghan, Harry and the rest of The Firm. Click here to sign up .She told the Mirror: The Queen has already assured the smooth transition of the monarchy by expressing her wish for Camilla to be Queen alongside Prince Charles. And the new King will want a streamlined modern monarchy in which Andrew was already surplus to requirements. He is, of course, a much-loved son and is adored by his ex-we, Fergie, and their two daughters. He will remain part of the royal family into which he was born, and I am sure the Queen will include him in family le. But there can be no public role for him ever again.  The fact is that Prince Andrew will forever remain tarnished by more than a decade of speculation about his friendship with a convicted paedophile.However, a report last week suggested Andrew could make a public appearance at a remembrance service for his late father Prince Philip next month.Sources told the Sun Andrew is expected at the ceremony at Westminster Abbey on March .Duke of York title stripped   While Andrew may have been stripped of his military affiliations and his royal patronages - he still retains his Duke of York title.And even though the civil claim been settled, he is facing renewed calls to give up his ducal title. Labour MP Rachael Maskell, who represents York Central, says Andrew must remove his association with the city in light of the out-of-court settlement reached with Virginia Giuffre. She added that she welcomed the Duke of York’s pledge to donate money to his accuser’s charity, but said his relationship with disgraced Jeffrey Epstein had damaged the city’s reputation. She said: “Although it is a relief that Prince Andrew has finally acknowledged and expressed regret for his close association with a convicted sex offender and sex trafficker Jeffrey Epstein, his long delay in doing so and initial response to the charges and Ms Giuffre have been source of deep hurt and embarrassment to many people across the city. “Carrying a title does create an ambassadorial relationship with that place, and for somewhere with a global reputation, such as York, this is extremely important.  “It is to be welcomed that he has now pledged to support the fight against the evils of sex trafficking and its victims. “To demonstrate his seriousness in this endeavour, and his respect for those affected by abuse and the people of our city, I would ask that his first act of contrition is to confirm his support for the withdrawal of his ducal title.” Quoting a poll from York’s daily newspaper The Press, she highlighted how  per cent of people in the city who were asked wanted Andrew’s association with it to be removed. Helping sex trafficking victims   In court documents filed yesterday indicating a settlement had been agreed, a statement was included in a letter submitted to US judge Lewis A Kaplan, who has been overseeing the civil sex claim brought by Ms Giuffre.In it, Andrew admitted his regret at his association with Jeffrey Epstein and also vowed to support sex trafficking victims. Part of the statement said: It is known that Jeffrey Epstein trafficked countless young girls over many years. “Prince Andrew regrets his association with Epstein, and commends the bravery of Ms. Giuffre and other survivors in standing up for themselves and others. “He pledges to demonstrate his regret for his association with Epstein by supporting the fight against the evils of sex trafficking, and by supporting its victims.”  However, Nazir Afzal, a former chief prosecutor, has said that he has spoken with many sexual attack victims and claims they have told him they would not work with Andrew.Writing in the Mirror, he said: Victims have been so badly affected by the language his legal team has been using I cannot think any of them will want to be in the same room as him. I’m patron of nine charities working with victims of sex offending. However, he added: I’m happy to offer him the opportunity to meet victims, in confidence, to understand their suffering and how victim-blaming of the type he indulged in will have affected them. title: you need know after covid
story: All you need to know after Covid jabs extended to all children over  in EnglandThe Joint Committee on Vaccination and Immunisation advice is for parents of --year-olds to get them vaccinated  they feel comfortable to protect against possible future Covid wavesChildren over five will be able to get a Covid vaccine from April Image: Getty ImagesByMartin BagotHealth and Science editor:,  Feb |comments All children over five in England will be able to get a coronavirus vaccine from April, the Government announced today. Two smaller doses of the Pfizer jab,  weeks apart, will be available to this age group to help control future Covid waves after Covid curbs have been lted.Professor Wei Shen Lim, Covid chair of the Joint Committee on Vaccination and Immunisation , said: The Committee has carefully considered the potential direct health impacts of vaccination and potential indirect educational impacts.The main purpose of offering vaccination to --year-olds is to increase their protection against severe illness in advance of a potential future wave of Covid-.Here is all you need to know...  What is the advice  The JCVI advice is for parents of --year-olds to get them vaccinated “ they feel comfortable” to protect against possible future Covid waves. They fear that should a new iant trigger a wave, at that point it will be too late to get all children in this age group protected by vaccination in time. The very small chance of severe complications in this age group is thought to be bigger than the even smaller chance of severe vaccine side effects. Some % of - year olds are thought to have already had Covid, however immunity wanes over time, particularly against mild infection.  What is dferent about this advice  While the independent experts advise that this age group should have the jab, the JCVI have issued a more nuanced message and stress it is not an emergency programme like previous vaccine drives. They say parents should not rush to get them vaccinated against Covid at the expense of school time or other childhood vaccinations such as the MMR jab. In the older  to  age group so far . million have received at least one dose. What was considered when deciding to recommend jabs for this age group  While school absences were considered this was not a signicant factor. This was because pupils can require time off with mild side effects - such fever, headache or sore arm - as well as requiring time off due to Covid. The main factor was the risk of serious illness to the child. The JCVI weighed up the extremely low risk of severe Covid symtoms versus the extremely low risk of severe vaccine side effects.  What is my child’s risk  In a future Covid wave between  and  cases of a rare inflammatory condition called PIMS-TS triggered by Covid will be prevented for every million double vaccinated - year olds. The JCVI also estimates that between  and  Covid hospitalisations will be prevented per million double jabbed in this age group, as well as up to three ICU admissions. This was compared to the risk of the most worrying vaccine side effect of Covid- vaccines, known as myocarditis. This is inflammation of the heart muscle and it is still unclear how harmful it is in the long term. The JCVI estimates it occurs in less than two per million children given the Pfizer jab.  How will rollout work It is yet to be decided whether vaccines will be administered to - year olds in schools or NHS centres.From April this age group will be offered two  micrograms doses of the Pfizer vaccine This is much less than the  microgram doses given to adults. They will be administered at least  weeks apart but the second dose may be delayed so it can be administered during school holidays. This is to avoid school absences caused by minor side effects such as fever, headache and sore arm. title: first victorias secret model downs
story: First Victorias Secret model with Downs syndrome says her dreams have come truePuerto Rican model Sofia Jirau, who made her debut at New York Fashion Week, has called it a "dream come true" to become the first Victorias Secret model with Downs syndromeThe Puerto Rican model Sofia Jirau makes history as the first Victorias Secret model with Down syndrome Image: NewsflashByLee BullenJoe Smith:,  Feb Updated:,  Feb |comments A woman has celebrated making history by becoming the first model with Downaposs syndrome to pose for Vocitria’s Secret. Sofia Jirau, a -year-old Puerto Rican model and activist told followers she is taking part in the American lingerie brandaposs new Love Cloud campaign - advertising the collection of everyday underwear. Sofia’s career has been gathering steam since she made her catwalk debut at New York Fashion Week in February  and she has been attracting the attention of the fashion industry throughout the pandemic.She took to social media to share her delight at posing for Victoria’s Secret, calling it ‘a dream come true’ but some online commenters have raised concerns about sexualising people with Down’s syndrome, saying they had ‘mixed emotions’ about the campaign. Victoria’s Secret has launched a string of initiatives over the past few years to try and regain credibility in the face of declining sales and past accusations of a culture of misogyny at the business.Recent moves by the company include its first mastectomy bra, racially erse models promoting underwear in dferent skin tones, and hiring transgender beauty Valentina Sampaio after being criticised for its lack of ersity. Victoria’s Secret as previously branded a apostransphobic, fat phobic company that sets out to exclude most womenapos, by TV star Jameela Jamil while shop closures and the cancelling of its high-profile catwalk showcase have added to the companyaposs woes in recent years.Celebrating the news of her campaign today on Instagram, Sofia said: aposOne day I dreamed of it, I worked on it and today it is a dream come true. I can finally tell you my big secret… I am the first Victoriaaposs Secret model with Downaposs syndrome.aposSharing a black and white picture of her modelling the brandaposs bra, she continued: aposThanks to all of you for always supporting me in my projects. Thanks to @victoriassecret for seeing me as a #NoLimits model and making me part of the Love Cloud Collection inclusion campaign. This is just the beginning, now itaposs formed.apos aposInside and out there are no limits, Alavett,apos she said, quoting her own brand, which is named after the English phrase aposI love it.apos Sofia shared a black and white snap of herself wearing a floral balcony bra from the brand with her , followers. As well as modelling, she works as an activist with her No Limits campaign, called Sin Límites, which aims to raise awareness about Down’s Syndrome.  Sofia also founded her own brand, Alavett, launching its online store in . She came to global attention when she made her catwalk debut at New York Fashion Week in February . She said she hoped her success would inspire other people with Down’s. Speaking at the time she said: “I am proud as one of the few models with Downaposs syndrome who have managed to participate in the important fashion event. “Modelling in the United States was the beginning of conquering the dream I have had since an early age - to model on the most important runways in the world.”  Victoria’s Secret launched their Love Cloud collection on Monday designed to be comfortable everyday underwear as part of their ongoing efforts to rebrand. The campaign sees  women modelling the range, some are professional models while others are inspiring women, to reinforce the message that the brand is for everyone. The inclusive campaign features Celilo Miles, a Nez Perce Tribe-Wildland firefighter and Sylvia Buckler, an accessory designer who models the bra while cradling her pregnant belly. Speaking to Vogue, Celilo said she still cannot believe she was selected for the campaign. aposI used to watch the Victoriaaposs Secret fashion show and wish that I could be up on that stage. aposEveryone wanted to be in that club, but you knew you didn’t belong there, she said. She added that when she started modelling she tried to lose weight in order to fit a size she could not sustain because she believed it was the done thing. The campaign also features plus-sized models like Paloma Elsesser, and Devyn Garcia.Voguehas noted the collection is the first under the tenure of Victoriaaposs Secretaposs new creative director Raúl Martinez, who has been working hard at rethinking how the brand markets itself to women.Read MoreRead More Most Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON New York Fashion WeekLingerieDowns syndrome" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. news us-news parents-boy--who-ordered-"Toddler accidentally orders almost , of items from WalmartBySam Elliott-GibbsReporter:,  Feb |comments A mum has vowed to password protect all her devices from now on after her cheeky one-year-old son ordered almost £,-worth of furniture online.Little Ayaansh Kumar took his mumaposs phone last month and had what his parents thought was some harmless fun. Thinking he was just enjoying the lights, his mum Madhu Kumar didnapost think too much of it - but he was actually surfing the net and splashing the cash. The family from New Jersey, US, got a knock at the door days later and piles and piles of huge boxes were sitting there ready for them. After looking at her online banking, she discovered almost , was missing.  The decor-loving lad, who is nearly two, had placed orders for chairs, flower stands and additional household items. A number of them were so large that they could barely fit through the front door.Ayaansh, who decided to order a number of items more than once, will have trouble repeating the trick in the near future. The family plan to keep a couple of the items as a memento of their totaposs adventure and have ed the rest to a nearby Walmart supermarket.  Thankfully, they have been told they will receive a refund. But Madhu told NBC New York she is taking measures to make sure no more online shopping can take place. He’s so little, he’s so cute, we were laughing that he ordered all this stuff, she said. It is really hard to believe that he has done this, but that’s what happened.  I need one or two items, why would we need four of the same thing  The mum has said that she will be placing much tighter controls on all her devices to prevent any more of Ayaanshaposs shopping sprees. She added: Moving forward, we will put tough passcodes or face recognition so when he picks up the phone he finds it in locked condition. title: cheek woman adds rude detail
story: Cheeky woman adds rude detail to her fence after neighbours complain about itA woman whose neighbours didnt want her and her partner to build a fence simply carried on and put one up regardless, adding one particularly naughty detail in an act of defianceShe wanted to add a little architectural detail for them to enjoy Image: @the_tiketytok TikTokByJulia BanimAudience Writer:,  Feb Updated:,  Feb |comments Disputes between neighbours can get pretty heated from time to time, with parking arguments or noise complaints unsettling the peace in even the most harmonious of neighbourhoods.One woman, whose name is Susie, recently revealed how she and her partner chose to erect a fence outside their home against their neighbouraposs wishes, with the pair jokily adding a little architectural detail for them to enjoy. Taking to TikTok, Susie shared a video of her partner cheekily erecting a large phallic shape on the fence, which can be swivelled upwards whenever they wish. She wrote: He goes along with my evil plans and I just love it.  Get the news you want straight to your inbox.for a Mirror newsletter here. One person commented that they would have opted for a middle finger instead, while another wisely cautioned: Now donapost get too cocky my friend. Keeping with the cheeky tone, a third person joked that they hoped Susie would add a sprinkler for those hot days to keep your pups cool.In response, Susie - who goes by the username the_tiketytok - revealed that she had wanted to share a video of her doing just that, but feared TikTok would take it down. Thankfully, in a follow-up vid, it becomes clear that Susie and her neighbour are actually on very friendly terms, with the neighbour seen howling with laughter as she takes in the X-rated fence.Clarying that there was no real bad blood between them, Susie revealed: She loved it. And for anyone saying she hates us, she was bringing us goodies. In the clip, the clearly amused neighbour can be heard describing the fence as being too funny before adding you guys are hysterical. Followers loved this surprise twist to the tale even more, with one writing: Thataposs the cool lady neighbour Iaposd hope to be...and Iaposm probably her elder. What a jewel she seems to be. Another said: This makes me miss my old neighbour! We called her grandma. Sheaposd bring over goodies all the time. even arranged a block party once! When quizzed as to why sheaposd made out that there was serious beef between them in the previous video, Susie added: Because it was freaking hilarious.Do you have a funny or shocking neighbour rivalry story to share  We pay for stories. title: hooters waitress baffles people revealing
story: Hooters waitress baffles people by revealing chains controversial tights ruleThe Hooters unorm - with its owl emblazoned tops and bright orange shorts - is recognisable the world over, however, many have been surprised to learn that employees pay for their own tightsThe tanned tights cost  per pair Image: @kenzjee TikTokByJulia BanimAudience Writer:,  Feb |commentsHooters unorms have proven to be a isive issue over the years, with many opponents of the brand regarding the skimpy shorts and low-cut tops to be sexist relics of a bygone era. However, now the unorm has come under fire for a very dferent reason, with two staff members claiming that they actually have to fork out for their own mandatory tights, which set them back  a pop.In a TikTok video that has been viewed more than . million times, a Hooters employee offered followers a glimpse at the Hootersapos tights machine and demonstrated exactly how it works.  Get the news you want straight to your inbox.for a Mirror newsletter here.As previously reported by theNew York Post ,the staff member - who goes by the username kenzjee - could be seen in what appears to be the staff bathroom, accompanied by a fellow employee.Addressing her .K followers, she said: “So people always ask me about our tights machine and I have to buy tights today, so I guess I’ll just make a video about it. She then slipped a  bill into the machine, selecting the option aposSuntan Bapos. As she explains, aposSuntan Bapos is the shortest pair of tights, while aposSuntan Dapos is the longest, but all of them are the same shade of tan. Her tights are then quickly dispensed, ready for her to pop on before her sht. As simple as this transaction may be, many have wondered why exactly Hooters Girls have to shell out of their own purses, with the cost of tights surely adding up after a few shts.One person wrote: It’s a company unorm, the company should pay for it, arguing that making money from your employees is bad business. Another person asked her outright why she had to pay for the tightsthey are a mandatory part of the unorm, remarking in my opinion the boss should provide them for free.. The TikToker replied, explaining: they have to sell tights through a third party company because tights are considered aposundergarmentsapos so they can’t provide them for us. When another commenter suggested that they could pay, they just choose not to, she confirmed that sheaposd already spoken with her regional manager on the topic, and had been reassured that the company couldnapost pay. Some of those commenting had worked at Hooters themselves, and knew about the tights rule all too well. One woman recalled that she had hated buying them and had spent  every damn day, while another claimed that sheaposd ripped mine every night and had to buy them from the manager. The third-party supplier seen advertised on the bathroom tights machine, Peavey Hosiery, charges . for a pair of Suntan Hosiery, while a second pantyhose provider, Tamara Hosiery, sells pairs of Hooters stockings for . or ..The Mirror has reached out to Hooters for comment. Do you have an interesting workplace-related story to share  We pay for stories. title: i convinced third nipple after
story: I was convinced I had a third nipple after breastmilk leaked from my armpitsLindsay White was convinced she had a third nipple after discovering a lump under her armpit, which sprayed milk when she squeezed it - now shes educating other women on the female anatomyLindsay was convinced she had a third nipple Image: @thelittlemilkbar TikTokByEmma RosemurgeyAudience Writer:,  Feb |comments A new mum has revealed how she was convinced sheaposd discovered a third nipple when she started heavily leaking breastmilk out her armpit. Lindsay White, who posts from her handle @thelittlemilkbar on TikTok, was breastfeeding her little girl, when she looked down and noticed her hair was all wet.At first, the TikToker assumed she mustaposve been sweating a lot - until she lted up her arm and noticed a huge lump on her armpit, which squirted out milk when she squeezed it. Taking to the app, Lindsay asked her followers: This is going to blow your mind. But did you know that you can leak breastmilk in places other than your boobs, like your armpit  For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newsletters here. One day I was feeding Allie and noticed that her hair was soaking wet, then I realised it was coming from my armpit, she explained. I thought I was just really sweaty but then noticed this huge lump, and thought, aposwhat the heck is that apos So I squeezed it, and holy s***, milk came out. Lindsay was absolutely baffled, and at first thought she might have a third nipple, but her doctor confirmed that is not the case. She said nope, your milk line actually runs all the way up through your armpits, the mum added. Wow. After sharing the news, Lindsay was inundated with comments from other mums who were shocked theyaposd never been taught this fact before. Maybe I wasnapost sweating and I was lactating constantly through my armpits, one confused mum wrote, while another demanded: Normalise womenaposs anatomy so owe can just know things like this from interacting with other women, thank you. We couldnapost agree more.Do you have a story to share  We want to hear all about it. story: I saved £ for Valentines gt - but took p away every time fiancée got mad at meA man has shared how he saved £ for his partners Valentines present, but throughout the year he would take money out of the potshe got mad and yelled at himTikTok star Isaac Ramirez said he took  from his fiances gt fund each time she yelled at himByJohn BettAudience Writer:,  Feb |comments A man saved a fortune on Valentineaposs Day by reducing the amount he planned to spend on his fiancée each time she yelled at him. Taking to TikTok, Isaac Ramirez , @iisaac.ramirezz, said that last year he put aside £so he could get his partner something nice on Valentineaposs Day.But he made a rule, each time she yelled at him he would take away p , and by the end of the year, there was only £.left in the pot. Isaacaposs video, which has been viewed over nine million times, then shows another envelope - which reads treat yourself, king, and itaposs full of cash.  What do you think of Isaacaposs technique  Let us know in the comments...In the clip, Isaac said: Last year I put  away for my fiancéeaposs Valentineaposs gt but I took away  every day she yelled at me. Now her gt limit is  and I saved myself . After uploading the video, Isaac was soon inundated with comments from people who praised the idea, but some pointed out a few ways to improve it. One said: You should add money when she surprises you with something special - your favourite drink, meal, something she bought that made her think of you. And Isaac replied: I like that idea. Then a second commented: Add a dollar for when it was justied.  For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newslettershere. To which Isaac said: Touché. But others were more concerned about Isaacaposs relationship and wellbeing, saying he should be careful. One wrote: It’s time to find a new girlshe yelling at you  days of the year dawg. title: mum fumes shes kicked out
story: Mum fumes as shes kicked out of wedding for refusing to remove daughters tiaraThe mum and her four-year-old daughter were asked to leave the wedding as the bride didnt like that the child was wearing a tiara - and the mum wouldnt remove itThe bride didnt want the toddler to wear a tiaraImage: Getty Images iStockphotoByZahna EklundAudience writer:,  Feb |comments Weddings are supposed to be a time of celebration in which family and friends of the bride and groom gather to watch them start the rest of their lives together. At any wedding, the newlywed husband and we are the focal point and usually hold most of the attention - and itaposs up to the guests to follow dress codes and instructions laid out by the stars of the show. But one mum on Reddit has been left fuming after she was recently kicked out of her cousinaposs wedding for letting her four-year-old daughter wear a tiara to the event, and then refusing to take it off when she was asked to do so by the bride.Sharing her story anonymously, the woman said her daughter has a fascination with princesses and loves wearing tiaras, but was asked to take the hair accessory off at the wedding because the bride wanted to be the only one wearing one.Get the news you want straight to your inbox.for a Mirror newsletter here. The -year-old mum wrote: My daughter Chloe has a fascination with princesses. She loves the colour pink, wears only dresses, and has an array of tiaras that she wears everywhere - except to pre-school, where she canapost. My cousin Alex invited us to his wedding, which was this past Saturday. Chloe was excited because she got to dress up and stay dressed up the entire time. She also couldn’t wait to see the bride’s dress. She askedshe could wear her princess tiara and I said of course. We got to the wedding on time. However, the start time was delayed for unknown reasons.  minutes after it was supposed to start, one of the bridesmaids came out and told me that the bride, Jen, was refusing to come out because my daughter was wearing a tiara.  I thought she was joking but she wasn’t. Apparently, the bride was also wearing a tiara and wanted to be the only one wearing it. The mum put her foot down and refused to remove her daughteraposs tiara, but was confronted by her cousin Alex, who told her she would have to leave the weddingshe didnapost comply with the request. She added: I told the bridesmaid that Chloe loves tiaras and always wears them. The bridesmaid said aposnot today she isn’tapos and told me it needed to be removed. I said no. The bride is a grown woman and was being petty over a child’s tiara. The bridesmaid left for a couple of minutes and then Alex himself came out. He told me to leave. I asked why and he said it was because I won’t tell Chloe to take off her tiara.  I said this was ridiculous and Alex said it’s not my wedding and when I get married then Chloe can wear one to mine, but that I’m officially uninvited regardless. Others around me told me to just take it off and I wouldn’t. Alex’s mum came over and escorted us out. The mum was baffled by the turn of events but agreed to leave the wedding - with her daughter left upset and crying out of fear that sheaposd done something wrong. She said: Chloe was upset and crying because she feels she did something wrong, and I’m upset because I can’t believe someone would be jealous over a literal -year-old. I also feel bad because Chloe was really looking forward to seeing Jen’s dress because she loves wedding dresses. But no one is on my side. And while commenters on Reddit agreed that the request to remove the tiara was slightly over-the-top, they also believed the mum was petulant and entitled for putting her foot down on the issue. One person wrote: You seriously need to parent-up and teach your kid that thereaposs a time and place for indulging your inner princess, and a time and place for sitting back, following dress codes and letting other people shine. For example, at their own goddamn weddings. You were asked nicely but were petulant and entitled. You caused this, itaposs not over a child, itaposs over your lack of parenting. Thereaposs a reason nobody is on your side. While another added: I agree with this. The four-year-old should be taught the time and place for attire. She didnapost wear a tiara to preschool, as mentioned by the mum, so a wedding is also a specic occasion. I personally would find it cuteI were the bride, but everyone is dferent I guess. I think the brideaposs wishes, while over the top here, should be respected.Do you have a story to sell  Get in touch with us at yourmirror@trinitymirror .Read MoreRead More Most Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON MarriageWeddingsUmm what Wedding day" data-immediate"data-immediate" to FREE email alerts with news to brighten your daySubscribeInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: my sisters relationship dog freaks
story: My sisters relationship with her dog freaks me out, she acts like hes her childThe man has questioned whether he has been too harsh on his sister after turning down an invite to her dogs second birthday - and laughing when nobody showed up to itHis sister treats her golden retriever like a child Image: Getty ImagesByPaige FreshwaterContent Editor:,  Feb |commentsA man has confessed to avoiding his sister because her close relationship with her dog ‘creeps him out’. Sharing his reasoning on Reddit, he explained how his -year-old sister has been treating her golden retriever like a child and even refers to herself as its ‘pawrent’.Labelling her as ‘delusional’, the final straw came when she invited her family to the dog’s second birthday party, with strict instructions to bring the pooch presents.The man said: “She sent me an invite for my aposnephewapossapos birthday bash - it disgusted me. “I talked to a couple of family members and we all laughed at her suggestions.to our TeamDogs newsletter for your weekly dose of dog news, pictures and stories. “My family thinks she needs therapy, while I think she is delusional.But it seems like there are a lot of people who spend their money on dogs.” He told his sister he was “too busy” to be able to attend the dog’s birthday party - and went through with his plans to watch a basketball game at his friend’s house.But his sister, who checked up on him on Instagram, deemed this an unacceptable reason to miss out on her golden retrieveraposs party.“She called me to tell me I was an a***hole,” he said. “I replied that I did not want her toxicity in my le and that she could go play pretend with her dog, but not expect any of us to part-take in this fantasy of hers. “She began crying and hung up.” The man later found out that nobody turned up to the dog’s birthday party, and although not at all surprised, he has been questioning whether he was too harsh on her.  While most users agreed he was not in the wrong for not wanting to attend the party, he could have handled it dferently. One user said: “Youaposre not the a***hole for not going to a dog birthday party because thataposs weird. “However you are the a***hole for laughing at your sister and belittling her. “If you genuinely think she needs help, talk to her and your family about it. Donapost just laugh behind her back.” While another said: “I agree itaposs overboard. I understand, not everyone is into their pets. But she loves her dog for a reason. Like every pet owner. “Another thing that bothers me is when you said: ‘Treating the dog as a child’. “The dog is the equivalent of a child. People forget this, but dogs are entirely dependent on us and have nothing  in their le aside from us, as their caretaker. “Is there an argument that weaposre imposing human qualities onto them like celebrating birthdays . Yes. “A dog isnapost going to be offended that no one comes to their birthday. All they care about is food, belly rubs and zooming around the park. “But dogs have emotions and feelings. They are bred to be dependent on us. We are their entire le. “So forget the lies that itaposs just a dog and not like a child. It is their child. Itaposs just imposing human qualities on them that people donapost get and rightfully so. “If anything, the fact she focuses so much love on her pet dog and her family ridiculing her suggest they arenapost supporting her in the first place.”Do you have a story to sell  Email paige.freshwater@reachplc.Read MoreRead More Most Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON Birthday partyTherapyTeamDogsDogs" data-immediate"data-immediate"Calling all dog lovers!to TeamDogs for your weekly dose of dog news, pictures and stories.Invalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: superfit gran looks half age
story: Superfit gran looks half her age and gets mistaken for granddaughters sisterGrandmother Lesley Maxwell, from Melbourne, Australia, works out five times a week to maintain her rock-hard abs and is so fit that shes often mistaken for someone half her ageLesley Maxwell and her granddaughter Tia Image: Jam Press lesleymaxwell.fitnessByJohn BettAudience WriterKatie Dollard:,  Feb |comments A super- fit grandmother has told how she looks so young that she is often mistaken for her granddaughteraposs sister - and believes sheaposs stopped ageing thanks to exercise.Lesley Maxwell, , works out five times a week to maintain her incredible figure, with rock-solid abs and a svelte waist, and claims it has aposreversed the ageing processapos. She said that whenever she goes out with her -year-old granddaughter, Tia, people assume the pair are friends or siblings, and no one guesses their true relationship. Lesley, from Melbourne, Australia, said that when she reveals her real age people are often astounded, and now sheaposs shared her top tips on looking young. How old did you guess Lesley is  Let us know in the comments...She said: I definitely think women come into their own as we become older – more confident and sexy, especiallywe are fit and healthy. We can actually reverse the ageing process through clean eating plus effective exercise. Build the muscle and burn the fat and having a healthy lean body is up to us. There are two ways of ageing – one is chronological age which is from your birthdate until now. The other is biological age, which is more exciting! We can create a younger body – become leaner, stronger, healthier. Lesley said that to get in shape you should avoid eating wheat, sugar, and junk food - instead opt for protein with every meal. For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newslettershere. Next, learn three good weight training exercises, starting with lighter weights and building up as you go, and take up walking - preferably outdoors and at a good pace. Lesley said she began her fitness journey later in le and won her first show aged , and has never looked back. Her trim physique also helps her stay confident in her love le, and the self-professed cougar is currently dating a younger man. She said: The man I’m seeing is younger than me but I never think about that. Confidence is a win for me. If a man is brave enough to walk straight up to me and stare me in the eyes and ask me out, he’s a pretty brave man. These days men are quite shy about approaching women as everything seems to be done online. Anyone can be romantic online but there’s nothing like the real thing. story: Woman gobsmacked to find full fried potato in a packet of Kettle ChipsTikTok user Katherine bought a packet of Kettle Chips and was surprised when she opened it to discover she had one great big crisp, as a whole potato had someone how snuck through the systemKatherines giant potato-crisp sure looks deliciousByJohn BettAudience Writer:,  Feb |comments A woman was left gobsmacked after she found a full fried potato in a packet of Kettle Chips.TikTok user Katherine bought a packet of salt and vinegar crisps and when she opened it she was in for a shock.She went to e in, but instead of a packet full of thin delicious crisps, she was left with a huge golden potato, covered in Kettleaposs iconic flavouring and perfectly fried. Now Katherine, , from Bristol, has shared a video of the crisp potato and her fans on social media all thought it looked delicious - but she said it didnapost taste so good.  What do you think of Katherineaposs potato crisp  Let us know in the comments... Katherine, @katherineeatsplants, shared her discovery on TikTok, where she wrote: Can someone from Kettle Chips tell me why I found a whole potato in the bag Her clip has been viewed more than , times and Katherine was inundated with comments. One said: That looks kinda nice tho. And a second added: It’s beautul. Then a third wrote: Maybe it’s like the gold creme egg, you might get a prize. That is the opposite problem of Walkers crisps, commented a fourth user. Kettle Chips have been approached for comment.  For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newslettershere.Meanwhile, a hungry man was left disappointed after buying an oven pizza from a Sainsburyaposs store as it had almost nothing on it - just a few strands of grated cheese.Tom Scott, a product designer, bought the pizza for p and he couldnapost see the lack of toppings as a huge sticker covered the face of the item.What he got was just bread and tomato sauce, with a few bits of grated cheese, and now he believes that Sainsburyaposs may have put that sticker on intentionally to hide the lack of toppings.Do you have a story to sell  Get in touch with us at yourmirror@trinitymirror.Read MoreRead More Most Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON ViralFood" data-immediate"data-immediate"Serve the food you really want to eat by signing up for our tips and recipes and never be bored by your cooking againSign UpInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: dog who looked like beached
story: Dog who looked like beached seal unrecognisable after halving body weightRosie tipped the scales at  stone when she was adopted - but has been able to drop a whopping four and a half stone through a combination of healthy diet and exerciseRosie weighed  stone in April  Image: Kennedy News and MediaByNia PricePaige FreshwaterContent Editor:,  Feb |commentsA pasta-obsessed dog who could only walk a few steps without stopping is now aposunrecognisableapos after losing half her body weight.Emmabele Hodges adopted Rosie after the death of a family member but when taken to the vet in April  was told she was the biggest dog theyaposd ever had in the practice as she tipped the scales at  stone.The -year-old said that after that apossurrealapos visit she knew that in order for her -year-old dog to have a happy and healthy le she needed to drop the pounds.Through a combination of healthy diet and exercise Rosie has dropped a whopping four and a half stone - and can now do aposjust about anything she wantsapos.The nursing assistant claims that since her weight loss Rosie, who needed a ramp to get in and out of a car, is a aposcompletely dferent dogapos. to our TeamDogs newsletter for your weekly dose of dog news, pictures and stories. Animal lover Emmabele describes Rosie as a aposbundle of joyapos and photos she shared online of her weight loss transformation have racked up more than , likes, comments and shares.Emmabele, of Thomasville, North Carolina, US, said: Sheaposs almost like a completely dferent dog. She can do so much more.The biggest transformation weaposve seen is watching her run because for years she couldnapost.She was just so slow with walking because of all the excess weight she had but now sheaposll run out the backyard or after a ball. Itaposs just completely night and day for that.She has done very well with her weight loss.All of our friends, and family in particular, some of them have mentioned to us over and over how great she looks. They cannot believe itaposs the same dog and theyaposre so proud of everything that weaposve done and that sheaposs been able to do.People havenapost recognised her. Iaposve posted pictures online and some of my friends have said aposthataposs Rosie  Thataposs the same dog apos.Rosie, who is a golden retriever, labrador, husky and chow-chow mix, was rescued by Emmabeleaposs in-laws when she was around four years old in .Emmabele said: We took her to the vet shortly after my mother-in-law passed away and thataposs when they told us she was the biggest dog they had ever had in the veterinary practice, which was very surreal to hear.They said thatwe wanted her to live a happy, long, healthy le, she wonapost be able to do it the size that she is.When we heard that we knew that we needed to give her the best rest of her years that we could.My husband and I took care of her and took it upon ourselves to do everything we could to get Rosie the healthiest she could be because at that point she was the heaviest she had ever been.Even with her being overweight, she has always been such a loving, happy and just awesome dog.You would never think that for a dog of her size she would still just be so playful and loving towards others. Sheaposs always been such a bundle of joy.Emmabele, who works in a childrenaposs hospital, said that multiple people were needed to hoist poor Rosie onto the examination table and scales.She was also told during their trip to the vets thatthey didnapost take drastic action it was unlikely that sheaposd live much longer given she was at high risk of developing an injury or diseases like cancer.Emmabele said: Her weight definitely crept on over the years. She is a mixture of four dferent breeds, which all have completely dferent metabolisms.The vet said that a mixture of the metabolisms seems to be what caused her weight gain because she wasnapost able to metabolise the food and burn off the calories the way that other dogs do.For years it was Rosie with her sister Piper who was a golden retriever terrier mix.She would eat the same things as her and was super active, but for whatever reason Rosie just always gained weight from what she was eating.Back then sheaposd eat some dog food but I think it was primarily table food.I think my mother-in-law was unable to resist her sweet little face and would give her all sorts of extra treats and stuff like that.Typically theyaposd give her a little bit of her dried dog food and put some shredded chicken on top of it, maybe some type of vegetable or a bit of egg and some boiled pasta over that. Pasta was a big thing.Before:Breakfast and dinner: Little bit of dried dog food with shredded chicken, egg and boiled pasta.Table food from owners.Treats: Vanilla wafer dog cookies or peanut butter dog treats. Now: Breakfast and dinner: Diet food with water.Treats: Healthier organic treats with blueberry and pumpkin or fresh seedless watermelon.She was very slow, weaposd try to take her on walks and it was just so hard for her. Just going on a walk for five minutes sheaposd have to stop every few steps.She would push through it and do her absolute best but I could tell that she wanted to do better.Sheaposd try and stay close to her sister and it was hard for her to see her move so much faster and she had to sit there and kind of watch. I could tell that it bothered her.Rosie started her diet in May  after the vet prescribed her specic food and treats and Emmabele also bought her an elevated feeder to help with her digestion.As Rosie started to shed some pounds, they then incorporated exercise into her routine and she now enjoys regular trips to the dog park. The apossweetapos and aposfriendlyapos pooch now weighs five and a half stone and has maintained since December.Emmabele said: We have stairs in our backyard and she would have to go up and down them to go to the bathroom.At one point sheaposd stand at the bottom and I guess almost prepare herself to go up them and sometimes weaposd have to encourage her.Even those two or three steps sheaposd struggle with.It was hard for her to even get in and out of the car, we had to have a ramp because she couldnapost hop in and out.She jumps for toys now and she definitely couldnapost before. She can jump in and out of the car by herself and roll on her back now as before she couldnapost roll over completely.It has amazed us to see all the things she can do now and seeing her realise that she can do them. She can do just about anything she wants to do. title: man who fell ocean claims
story: Man who fell into ocean claims he was helped by seal during five-hour swim to safetyScott Thompson fell into the Santa Barbara Channel, near the city of Santa Barbara, off the coast of Calornia, sometime last month wearing only shorts and a T-shirt who fell into the Santa Barbara Channel" content"https:i-prod.mirror incoming article.ece ALTERNATES n _PAY-Newsflash-ScottThompson-.jpg" width"" "" Southern Calornia boater Scott Thompsonwho fell into the Santa Barbara Channel Image: NewsflashByJoe Golder:,  Feb |commentsA man who fell into the Pacic Ocean from a motorboat is claiming he was helped by a le-saving seal that nudged him along during his five-hour swim to safety. Scott Thompson fell into the Santa Barbara Channel, near the city of Santa Barbara, off the coast of Calornia, sometime last month wearing only shorts and a T-shirt. He said the terrying ordeal happened in the middle of the night, miles away from dry land. He said: I thought to myself, great, this is how Iaposm going to die. Today is the day Iaposm going to die. His motorboat continued on without him, with Thompson saying that this was when he realised he was in serious trouble. He tried swimming towards the boat, but quickly realised it was getting further away. Thompson is reportedly an experienced swimmer and an expert er, but he nonetheless felt panic set in as the cold chilled his body.  Thompson told himself to keep swimming and, thinking of his family, he started moving through the water. He said he told himself to just keep swimming, you gotta get home to your family. Thompson said: I was devastating myself, through my mind, just picturing my girls and my son growing up without me, and my we, you know, not having a husband to support her... “I wasnapost thinking about sharks or anything like that, until I hear this splash. He quickly realised it was a medium-sized harbour seal and he said it went under the water and nudged him like a dog comes up and nudges your leg. He reportedly saw it as a sign from God that he could make it. He said: Did it know, like hey, this human is in trouble, hey keep going dude  He kept swimming, not towards dry land, but towards an oil rig, which, while far away, was closer to him than the shore. He said: It started getting brighter and Iaposm just like, Iaposm crying. And Iaposm like, shouting at the sky. He was noticed by the crew on the  and they rescued him from the water. He was then taken by the coastguard to hospital, where he was treated for hypothermia among other ailments. His vessel was retrieved by a tow boat crew, who reportedly could not believe that he had survived the ordeal. Channel Watch Marine Paul Amaral said: Even putting on a wetsuit, being prepared, getting in that water, and swimming to the  was horrendous. I canapost imagine being in the water with shorts and a T-shirt at night. There was no moon, I mean it was pitch black. title: mh370 search team claim exact
story: MH search team claim exact location of missing mystery jet is closeA fresh hunt has been launched for the Malaysian Airlines flight MH jet after a new report has claimed to pinpoint a possible resting place of the missing planeA tribute to the missing jet at a beach in Malaysia Image: AFP via Getty ImagesByKieren WilliamsNews Reporter:,  Feb Updated:,  Feb |comments A fresh hunt for the missing MH airplane has been launched as investigators scour the seabed for the missing jet. Eight years after the flight vanished, a new report claims to have found the “exact location” of the Malaysian Airlines jet.It vanished in March , along with the  passengers and crew onboard, with no one able to confirm what happened to it. The plane departed Kuala Lumpur bound for Beijing on March , but lost contact with air traffic control after  minutes. However now, new technology could solve the nearly decade old mystery. Australian air safety investigators have renewed their search after a report from Richard Godfrey, a British aerospace engineer.  He has claimed that the plane went down km west of Perth and currently sits at the bottom of the ocean under ,m of water. Angus Mitchell of the Australian Transport Safety Bureau has renewed focus on what he calls “the largest unsolved mystery of our time”. Mr Mitchell stressed he did not want give the victims’ families  hope, but said that Mr Godfrey’s research was “credible” but stopped short of saying it would be enough to find the aircraft.In an upcoming Sky News Australia documentary, the Australian Transport Safety Bureau has confirmed it and Geoscience Australia have been looking over Godfreyaposs data. While the bureauaposs involvement in the search officially concluded five years ago, their new chief commissioner Mitchell has renewed focus on the missing plane. Godfrey, a Germany-based Brit, first became interested in doomed flights after the Air France Flight  vanished on its way from Rio de Janeiro to Paris, in May .  He had been due to fly on it, but was asked to remain in South America on business, which delayed his departure by two weeks, saving his le. The flight disappeared with  people on board and it was only found in the Atlantic two years later. He said: When I saw that Air France  had crashed in the middle of the Atlantic I got involved in reading up on that story and followed the underwater search for the wreckage. The Mirroraposs newsletter brings you the latest news, exciting showbiz and TV stories, sport updates and essential political information.The newsletter is emailed out first thing every morning, at noon and every evening. Never miss a moment by signing up to our newsletter here.  I dodged death. There but for the grace of God go I. When I saw what happened with MH I saw parallels and had to look into it. He said he has been able to track the planeaposs final movements using a system called Weak Signal Propagation, or, in his words a bunch of tripwires that work in every direction over the horizon to the other side of the globe, which are triggered when planes disrupt the signal when they fly through. title: woman kicked out vatican over
story: Woman kicked out of Vatican over sexy outfit says she will stop being CatholicJuju Vieira wore a fitted dress and long boots to the headquarters of the Roman Catholic Church but was told she was not dressed properly and asked to leaveJuju Vieira was on a trip to Saint Peters Basilica when she claims she was asked to leave Image: Jam Press @jujuvieira_oficialByAlmara AbgarianLaura SharmanNews Reporter:,  Feb |commentsAn influencer who claimed she was thrown out of the Vatican for being too sexy has vowed to give up Catholicism because of how she was treated. Juju Vieira, who is originally from Brazil, was on a trip to Saint Peteraposs Basilica at the heart of the holy city during a trip to Rome in January. The model, who was wearing a fitted dress and long boots during her visit, claims that while there she was told she was not dressed properly and asked to leave. Since then Juju, who is baptised and was raised in a strict Christian home and regularly attended mass, claims she has been persecuted by trolls online, who are sending hateful message. “I met the lack of God in the hearts of people who call themselves Catholic in the worst possible way,” she said.  They found out my number and I even received threats. I don’t identy with that kind of religious conduct.”According to the Instagram star, who has , followers, the verbal attacks are mostly coming from the most orthodox part of the community.As a result of what happened at the Vatican and the resulting abuse, she has now decided to give up her faith and explore other religions. “I want to be who I am, dress the way I want, sexy or not,” she said. I want to know other religions, today I identy more with spiritism”. The Vatican has a strict dress code for both men and women, which involves covering shoulders and knees. The website states: “Women are not permitted to wear sleeveless tops, crop tops, or tight shirts. Shoulders should be covered, andwearing a skirt or dress, it must cover the knees. “It is usually a good idea for women to bring a shawl and a pair of leggings when visiting during the colder months, as well as a light jacket that can be rolled up into a pleasingly tiny bag.”Juju said: “I went to the Vatican like everyone  goes to take pictures. “A gentleman who worked there came close to me and said that the place was for prayers and that I was not dressed properly and invited me to leave, aposkickedapos me out of the Vatican. “I was embarrassed because there were other people there who heard this. I felt disrespected.” Juju claims she was not aware of the code and was dressed as she would normally for a day out. The model said: “I didnapost even know there were rules.  A person of common sense will not visit the Vatican in club clothes. I was stylish in my winter clothes, everything matched. “I went in comfortable clothes that I would feel good in for long walks. Comfort was my only concern.” Juju also shared her experience with her Instagram followers in a video. Speaking in Portuguese, she told them the story, describing it as an “unpleasant situation”. One person wrote: “This is absurd my friend.” Another simply posted shocked face emojis. Others however claimed that it is common for people to be asked to leave for not following the dress code. One person wrote: “Well,you go dressed with deep necklines, very tight clothes, thataposs normal. They didn’t let my niece in also with a miniskirt and belly out.” Thehas contacted the Vatican for comment. title: caley marts on the hunt for auctioneers to handle increasing throughput
story: We are excited to announce a new home for the Evening Express content online, with a bigger and better website in partnership with The Press and Journal. We have spoken to our readers, and our aim is to deliver you everything that you need to know, together in one place.If you are a subscriber or thinking about joining our digital community, find out what it means for you below.In order to give you access to the news that you need, we have expanded our newsrooms and created dedicated news teams to serve you and our extended local communities across Aberdeen, Aberdeenshire, the Highlands and Islands and the North and North-East of Scotland. We will deliver you more content, live news as it happens, as well as breaking crime news and the latest from court, together in one place. We have also found new ways of telling our stories online, from in-depth investigations through to full- documentaries and podcasts.There is no change to The Press and Journal and the Evening Express newspaper or ePapers. The newspapers will continue to be available for purchase at your local store, delivered to your home, or as an ePaper . We will continue to deliver you the best stories in print, that you have come to expect from the PJ and the Evening Express.Our ePapers are a full replica version of the newspaper, published online,  days a week. You can access the PJ and the Evening Express ePaper via our dedicated ePaper apps where you can save and share stories, access all the paper supplements easily via their dedicated menu and even play interactive puzzles!If you would like to find out more about subscribing to the PJ or the Evening Express ePaper, please contact our Digital News Subscriptions Team on Your subscription to the Press and Journal will allow you to access all of the Evening Express stories which are now available on the PJ website. All of the best Evening Express content, including columnists and football analysis will now appear on the PJ website and will be available for you as part of your subscription.If you have an ePaper subscription there will be no change as to how you access your Press and Journal ePaper.The new website is now live. Evening Express content can now be found on The Press and Journal website.When you purchased your subscription an email was sent to your account with your login details. To reset your password please use the following link.Please contact our Digital News Subscriptions Team, on  Monday # Friday, am # pm, or email.Your subscription will continue as normal and all your existing subscriber benefits will remain in place. There are changes as to how you access your subscription benefits. See below, depending on what type of subscription you have.If you are an existing Evening Express Web subscriber, you can log in to your account as normal through The Press and Journal website.If you have an ePaper subscription you can access your ePaper on The Press and Journal website here.Or via a new link in your Daily ePaper email.There is no change to your reoccurring billing agreement. If you purchase a new subscription through The PJ website the price is subject to change and may be more than your current subscription. If you have any questions about your current subscription or how to access your subscription benefits in the future, please contact our Digital News Subscriptions Team, on   Monday # Friday, am # pm, or email.The new website is now live. Evening Express content can now be found on The Press and Journal website.Your subscription will continue as normal and all your existing subscriber benefits will remain in place.You can access your ePaper on The Press and Journal website here.Or via a new link in your Daily ePaper email.If you have any questions about your current subscription or how to access your subscription benefits in the future, please contact our Digital News Subscription Team   , or email.Yes, we will still send you a daily ePaper reminder with a link to the Evening Express ePaper, every time there is a new ePaper available .No, the Evening Express ePaper app will remain exactly the same.If you are an existing Evening Express Web subscriber, you can log in to your account as normal through the PJ website here.If you have an ePaper subscription you can access your ePaper on the PJ website here.Or via a new link in your Daily ePaper email.Yes, your existing Evening Express login details work on The Press and Journal. To log in please visit www.pressandjournal login.If you have any problems logging in, please contact our Digital News Subscription Team on  , or email.When you purchased your subscription, an email was sent to your account with your login details. To reset your password please use the following link.No, your existing reoccurring billing agreement will not change. If you cancel this agreement you can still purchase a new subscription in the future through The Press and Journal website. The price is subject to change and may be more than your current subscription.If you have any questions about your current subscription or how to access your subscription benefits in the future, please contact our Digital News Subscription Team   , or email.Please contact our Digital News Subscription Team on    Monday # Friday, am # pm, or email.The Evening Express website is no longer available. If you navigate to the Evening Express website or have website links saved, you will be automatically redirected to The Press and Journal website.Yes. You will find all the content that you would have normally found at the Evening Express here.Our combined newsroom will deliver you all of the Evening Express content that you would expect from The Evening Express website, plus more! We will continue to bring you the very best local news, football insight and in-depth features, as well as your favourite Evening Express columnists. These can all be found on The Press and Journal website as well as live news # updated as it happens # breaking crime news and the latest from court. You can also find our very best content that was published originally on the Evening Express website. These articles will be marked as originally appearing on the Evening Express website.Some Evening Express content will be moved to The Press and Journal website. Your bookmarked links will automatically redirect to the corresponding page on The Press and Journal website.Yes, The Press and Journal and the Evening Express social pages will continue. We will curate content specically for our audiences through our Facebook, Twitter and Instagram channels. All articles will link to The PJ website.Your registration details that you set up on the Evening Express website will work on The Press and Journal website. Please log in to your account as normal via the top right hand corner of the website or with this link.If you have forgotten your login or password please click the password reset link and follow the instructions.Yes. All registered users can access  free articlesevery  days. Please note, this information is correct at the time of publication, however, DC Thomson reserve the right to change this in the future.No, you will no longer receive Evening Express branded newsletters. You will now receive Press and Journal newsletters. If you do not wish to receive these, click the #unsubscribe# link at the bottom of the newsletter email.The Press and Journal has a Web subscription available which will give you access to all content on site from The Press and Journal and the Evening Express. You can purchase a PJ Web or PJ ePaper subscription here: www.pressandjournal subscribeThe Evening Express ePaper subscription is still available for purchase here.If you need help deciding what subscription is best for you, our Digital News Subscriptions Team are standing by to help. Please call on    Monday # Friday, am # pm, or email.No, there is only one Web subscription available on The Press and Journal. The Press and Journal Web subscription will give you access to all content on site from The PJ and the Evening Express. You can purchase a Press and Journal Web or Press and Journal ePaper subscription here.If you have an existing Evening Express Web subscription then all your subscription benefits are now available on The Press and Journal site. You have access to a bigger and better website, with all your favourite Evening Express content plus more.If you need help deciding what subscription is best for you, our Digital News Subscriptions Team are standing by to help. Please call on    Monday # Friday, am # pm, or email.You can purchase an Evening Express ePaper subscription here.Yes, you can. Our ePapers are an exact digital replica of the newspaper and carry unique content in both titles.
